metadata.title: Compacts of Influence — Envoys and Negotiators
metadata.summary: Reference entries for spirits enlisted to sway allegiances, close bargains, or stabilize fragile coalitions before open conflict erupts.

references.title: The Lesser Key of Solomon: Ars Goetia

body: Use this register when the aim is leverage: each entry details a spirit positioned to broker concessions, mute dissent, or lace a negotiation with binding glamour.

Aamon — Purpose: Reconcile estranged factions and surface strategic compromises. Manifestation: raven-headed wolf who speaks in mirrored arguments until consensus forms. Favours: myrrh incense blended with crushed rosemary and laid between disputants. Wards: copper quills bound in triads; recite all terms aloud to prevent hidden clauses.

Abalam — Purpose: Inflame ambition within a chosen proxy so they seize command on the summoner's behalf. Manifestation: twin-faced envoy whose smiles reflect the hunger of the court. Favours: mirror-polished bronze discs positioned behind the target's chair. Wards: issue every decree in triple witness to dissipate her lingering glamour.

Andras — Purpose: Collapse alliances by sowing suspicion during council. Manifestation: winged executioner astride a wolf, talons tapping out accusations no one recalls making. Favours: unsigned contracts rushed through dusk. Wards: oak tokens passed clockwise before deliberation anchor trust against his whispers.

Paimon — Purpose: Secure sovereign counsel and the loyalty of high officers through shared feasts and proclamations. Manifestation: crowned king on a dromedary, voice layered like trumpets delivering hidden arts. Favours: sweet wine, resounding choral music, and gold-threaded cushions. Wards: maintain dual ledgers—one spoken, one silent—to detect embellishment and revoke false boons.

Lucifuge Rofocale — Purpose: Broker wealth-for-secrecy covenants where payment and silence must remain perfectly balanced. Manifestation: veiled chancellor whose presence dims lanternlight and muffles testimony. Favours: impeccably balanced ledgers sealed in black wax. Wards: conduct bargains at noon sunlight, notarize every exchange, and ring iron bells when the pact concludes.
